abstract.text: Returns an array of chapters with a locale that best matches the list of preferred languages.

inlineContent.text: An array of BCP 47 language identifier strings. The order of the identifiers in the array reflects the preferred language order, with the most preferred language being first in the array. Typically, you pass the user’s preferred languages by retrieving this array from the
Each object in the returned array contains an
object representing the chapter title. The time range property of the
object is equal to the time range of the chapter title item.
The metadata group contains all chapter metadata, including items with the common key
, if such items are present. The system adds an
with the specified common key to an existing
object if the time range (timestamp and duration) of the metadata item and the metadata group overlap. The locale of such items don’t need to match the locale of the chapter titles.
method to further filter the metadata items in each group. You can also filter the returned items based on locale using the

abstract.text: Work with audiovisual assets, control device cameras, process audio, and configure system audio interactions.
An object that models timed audiovisual media.
The locales of the asset’s chapter metadata.
Returns an array of chapters with a locale that best matches the list of preferred languages.
Returns an array of chapters that contain the specified title locale and common keys.
Loads chapter metadata with a locale that best matches the list of preferred languages.
A metadata item for an audiovisual asset or one of its tracks.
Returns metadata items whose locales match one of the specified language identifiers.
Returns metadata items that match a specified locale.
A key that represents an image relating to the album.
A collection of metadata items that are valid for use during a specific time range.
Add chapter markers to enable users to quickly navigate your content.
An object representing information about linguistic, cultural, and technological conventions that bridges to ; use  when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
An ordered list of the user's preferred languages.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.

value.text: Information about linguistic, cultural, and technological conventions for use in formatting data for presentation.
